subject: [Legal Notice] Updated Data Processing Amendment for Google Workspace and Cloud Identity services

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
Update to reflect new UK Addendum to Standard Contractual Clauses and consolidated data processing terms for Cloud services.

Dear Partner,

This message is to inform you that your Google Workspace (including Google Workspace for Education) and Cloud Identity customers will be contacted by Google regarding the availability of an updated version of the Data Processing Amendment (the "DPA"), now called the Cloud Data Processing Addendum (the "CDPA").

The CDPA consolidates the DPA and the Data Processing and Security Terms previously offered for Google Cloud Platform (now known as Google Cloud), and incorporates the new international data transfer addendum issued by the UK's Information Commissioner (the "UK Addendum") into our EU Standard Contractual Clauses ("SCCs").

What does this mean for my customers?

We've included a copy of the email your customers will receive directly from us, including a link to the updated CDPA which will apply to their use of Google Workspace (including Google Workspace for Education) and Cloud Identity.

What do I need to do?

We encourage you to support your customers with questions about this process as appropriate. You can find additional information relating to Google's approach to the EU SCCs and the UK Addendum in this Google Cloud's Approach to European Standard Contractual Clauses whitepaper.

If your customers have questions, you can direct them to follow these steps:

  1. Sign in to the Admin Console to contact Google's Cloud Data Protection Team.
  2. Use the form under Account settings > Legal & Compliance > Data privacy officer enquiry
  3. Mention the subject of this email in the field Description.

We're here to help

If you have questions or need assistance, please contact Google Workspace partner support. When you submit your support case, please mention the subject of this email.

Thanks for choosing Google Workspace or Cloud Identity

- The Google Cloud Team

Here is the notification we sent to your affected customers:

Dear Administrator,

We are writing to inform you that we have updated the Data Processing Amendment (the "DPA") for Google Workspace (including Workspace for Education) and Cloud Identity, and renamed the DPA as the Cloud Data Processing Addendum (the "CDPA").

With this update, we have:

  • incorporated the new international data transfer addendum issued by the UK's Information Commissioner (the "UK Addendum") into our EU Standard Contractual Clauses ("SCCs"), replacing the separate UK SCCs previously approved under the Data Protection Directive 95/46;
  • consolidated the DPA and the Data Processing and Security Terms previously offered for Google Cloud Platform (now known as Google Cloud), to streamline and strengthen our data processing commitments for multiple Cloud services in one CDPA.

What does this mean for my organization?

You can refer to the CDPA to view the updated terms and our commitments to you.

What do I need to do?

This update does not require any action on your part. However, if your billing address is outside EMEA and any European data protection law applies to your use of Google Workspace (including Workspace for Education) or Cloud Identity, you need to follow the Privacy compliance and records for Google Workspace and Cloud Identity instructions to certify that such law applies to you, and provide details of your supervisory authority.

We're here to help

You can find additional information relating to Google's approach to the EU SCCs and the UK Addendum in the Google Cloud's Approach to European Standard Contractual Clauses whitepaper.

If you have any questions please follow these steps:

  1. Sign in to the Admin Console to contact Google's Cloud Data Protection Team.
  2. Use the form under Account settings > Legal & Compliance > Data privacy officer enquiry
  3. Mention the subject of this email in the field Description.

If you have further questions or need additional assistance, please contact Google Workspace support.

Thanks for choosing Google Workspace or Cloud Identity.

- The Google Cloud Team
